dialogue: ...What a bunch of cancel culture bullshit...
I'm sorry about this, Jasper. Claude sent me to...
You know, A LOT of people are fine with what I did, given the circumstances, they actually had no problem with it. If you read the comment section, it's like two-to- one my side.
Sucks...

Fuck 'em. Fuck 'em. 120 day suspension, WITH PAY. Fuck. Fuckin' fine with me - I'm going fishin', motherfuckers. I'll spend the whole summer in Pensacola. See how everyone around here does without me... and why are you in my car?
Uh, Claude said to get your mic and transmitter.
So, who's going in my place?
You? Oh...
Right? I feel like there are better candidates.
Yeah, yeah. Eh, makes sense - you got this unreadable face, perfectly forgettable.
I know...so, I've been listening in on these for a while, I kinda know what to say, but... any wisdom? Or tricks?
Bottom line - they gotta believe it. They want you to be this killer, so you gotta be that - you can't show any weakness. It's constant aggression until you hear the words out of their mouth.
Got it.
But you gotta be relaxed... easy- breezy...
Alright, so, I'm looking for --
Your job is to put these assholes in prison... what's up, Claude?
Oh, man... Go time.
You only get one first impression. Don't fuck it up. You're not wearing those in there, are you?
Public good?! What you did was one of the most unprofessional things I’ve ever witnessed. See? This is what happens when you send an untrained boy to do a man’s job.
C'mon - I steered clear of entrapment...
You let the jury decide that - at least you got 'em in custody.
Well, we'll never know since this weirdo let her off before she could start incriminating herself. It was, let's say, an unusual outcome, and it'll be written up as such.
Okay, fine...
Maybe it will. He relishes Gary's uncomfortable situation for an extra beat, then let's him off his hook.
Okay, well I'll let you guys get back to your dessert. Just wanted to say hi. Have a good night. Enjoy the weekend.
Alright.
What are we doing? I got no notice, I got no research, feel like I'm going in naked.
This is when you actually have to be good at your job. Halloween's over. No more costumes, man.
Okay...
Enjoy your breakfast.
Mike?
What the fuck was that?
What?
Guy just bolts out?
I don't know - he panicked. You can't win 'em all.
No, you sure can't with that attitude. If they're uneasy, you put 'em at ease. From my perspective, you're getting a little sloppy.
Maybe so. Look, I wanted to talk with you about the other night...
Oh?? What about it?
Oh, her? Hey, I get it, man. All makes sense to me now. It's cool - I've fucked my share of suspects. It's no big deal - it's good for ya.
I just ran into her...she was just thanking me for steering her in the right direction.
Uh huh, I bet she was.
I just don't want things to get misconstrued.
Gary, you can trust me. About the most insincere line you've ever heard.
Looking for the boyfriend...
Oh shit! Found him!
Fuuuck. I'm good.
C'mon. What are we doing here?
Hey, look... I'm not going to tell anybody.
Tell 'em what?! So I ran into her again - doesn't mean I'm the boyfriend, doesn't mean I have anything to do with anything.
Whoa, whoa. So defensive. Look, nobody's accusing you of anything. I was just wondering if you knew this guy? Does he look familiar?
Yeah, that's the guy that ran out of the restaurant... was his name Mike?
Ray... Madison's husband, right?
Right.

You see, I went back and listened to that conversation that you guys had, and it just took on a whole different layer of meaning for me. You really knew what button to push with that whole boyfriend line, huh?
What are you getting at?

Nothing. Look, we're friends, right, Gary? I'll let you in on something, over the years, I've sort of learned to follow my nose on these hunches that I have and - usually something turns up pretty interesting... valuable.
Let me know what you find. Jasper has him -- so why isn't he going in for the kill...?
Maybe. Well, I don't know... There's nothing here.
Yeah, that was Madison.
Huh...
Me?
Yeah. Question: when you ran into her, were you Gary or were you the hitman - which one were you going under on that one?
Ron.
Okay, so you're still Ron the hitman to her?
Who else would I be?

This is great. Look - she forever knows that he knows that she wanted to kill the guy, and she must like him or trust him enough to be sharing a Sundae at Ted's Frostop. Let's face it - they got the goods on each other, I mean, she'd never in a million years suspect he's recording their conversation. I think we got an opportunity here.
I'm hearing they're looking for him...
Nail her on the insurance policy.
Yeah, I tend to agree. I don't think she did it. Great work in there, Gary.
So, this mystery guy, the one who pulled the gun on him? Should we try to hunt that guy down?
Nah, he just seems like some guy who pulled a gun on an asshole in an alleyway. Nothing much happened.
So, what's going on, Jasper?

I was literally just telling Madison what phenomenal actors you guys are. So, I had to get backstage, poke my head inside the green room. Your performance was flawless, but you, you my friend, knocked my fucking socks off. Maybe I never gave you enough credit, Gary. Or... Ron. Sorry. Gary...Ron... I get them mixed up sometimes. Do you?
You got nothing, Jasper...
Well, I...
Because there isn't anything. That we're dating?
Oh shit, I didn't know that. Congratulations.
You think anybody gives a shit? You've already played your hand here, so fuck you, get lost!
Help us out?

Oh, Jesus Christ, Gary! Enough. Ok?! Enough! Ok?! Cut the bullshit. Here, I'll go first, alright? I've been following both of you. And I'll be even more honest, I wanted my job back. Nothing against you personally, ok, but holy shit! I've got enough evidence to put you away for life, and you... accomplice to murder? Whoooa dogggie. You're gonna be there for a while, and the only reason that I'm 100 percent sure you did it, is because I'm 100 percent sure that your Mr. Tough Guy here couldn't fucking kill a thing.
This house is hot.
Ironically, life insurance might have actually saved you guys here. That money got me thinking that this dark, fucking adventure that we've all been on can actually have a happy ending.
The day you hand over the cash...is the...
Oh, man...
Fuck.
